svcsubproc.title: Valve Installation

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields whenever using compressed air for cleaning purposes. Limit the air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi). See "Safety Information."

svcsubproc.para: Clean valve faces and seats with a suitable cleaning solvent to remove all dirt or foreign material. Blow dry all new and used components using filtered compressed air.

note.para: Guides must be clean! Use a Valve Guide Brush to clean guides.

step1.para: Dry valve guides with filtered compressed air.
Lubricate inside diameter of new valve stem seal and inside diameter of valve guide with clean engine oil. Install stem seal over valve guide until it stops.

note.para: Valve seal will not seat completely over valve guide by hand. Seals can be seated using a suitable deep socket and rubber mallet to provide a positive contact with machined base.

step1.para: Lubricate valve stem with clean engine oil.

figure.caption: Installing the valve seal, spring, and retainer

step1.para: Place valve spring over valve stem seal.
Install valve spring retainer on top of spring.
Lubricate the valves with clean engine oil. Insert the valve stems into their respective valve guide bores in the cylinder head.
Attach valve spring compression tool and compress valve spring. Install the retainer keys and release valve spring compression tool.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, be sure the retainer keys are correctly seated in each valve stem.

step1.para: After valve replacement, measure valve head recession relative to deck to confirm reconditioning. See Specifications.
